29.0: "What brightens the eyes". The light of the eyes (clarity?) in a doubtful thing gladdens the heart, because in the world there is no joy like the resolution (lit. "loosening", permitting) of doubts.
29.1: "Good news". In a matter of innovative Torah thoughts ("chidushei Torah").

5.0: Start to accustom the boy in his [early] years to the service of God through wisdom in things small and big; once he is accustomed to serving God well, when he grows old he will not stray [from the path] because his deeds will be enlightened.

15.0: For even if the righteous have fallen seven times, they will return and rise. However, the wicked are ones who are stumbling without rising and evil befalls them.
